project.title: Soralo Women Led Grass seedbanks
project.description:
### ğŸŒ The Challenge Weâ€™re Tackling 
In Kenyaâ€™s South Rift Valley, the degradation of grasslands is threatening pastoral livelihoods, wildlife habitats, and cultural heritage. As grass cover disappears, so does the food for livestock and wildlife, leading to increased conflict and vulnerabilityâ€”especially for women who depend on the land for household sustenance. If we do nothing, we risk losing both biodiversity and traditional ways of life.

### ğŸ“œ Our Solution 
We are restoring degraded rangelands through a community-led grass seed bank. This 20-acre seedbank, managed by a local womenâ€™s group, not only rehabilitates the land but also generates income through the sale of native grass seeds and hay. Itâ€™s a nature-based solution that empowers women, supports livestock production, and protects critical ecosystemsâ€”all rooted in indigenous knowledge and community leadership.

### ğŸŒ± Our Organisation / Community 
We are SORALO (South Rift Association of Land Owners), a land trust representing 16 Maasai communities working across over 2 million acres. Our work is guided by Enkopâ€™ang (Our Land) and Erematare (Stewardship)â€”cultural principles that drive our mission to protect and restore this shared landscape for both people and wildlife.

ğŸ–¼ï¸ See Our Impact

ğŸ”— [View our ecocert here](https://www.ecocertain.xyz/hypercert/42220-0x16bA53B74c234C870c61EFC04cD418B8f2865959-33687954325172907882874086135745052934144)

![alt text](https://ecocertain.vercel.app/_next/image?url=%2Fapi%2Fhypercert-image%2F42220-0x16bA53B74c234C870c61EFC04cD418B8f2865959-33687954325172907882874086135745052934144&w=640&q=75)

### ğŸ“ What This Hypercert Represents 
This hypercert represents the successful establishment of one 20-acre community grass seed bank. In its first year:
Grass seeds worth 814,380 KES were harvested and disbursed.
Hay worth 200,000 KES was sold to support local livestock.
Community members constructed 3,780 earth smiles, contributing labor valued at over 638,820 KES. This initiative is restoring degraded rangelands and improving womenâ€™s livelihoods.

### ğŸ“‚ See the Proof of Impact: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1kcyfeVc7Uin85jxcRNyzRElbucPnb-5t?usp=drive_link

### ğŸ’¡ Join Us in Making a Difference! 
Your support helps us scale this solution to more communities. By investing in women-led restoration, youâ€™re not just planting grassâ€”youâ€™re planting hope, resilience, and opportunity. Help us grow the next seedbank. Letâ€™s restore the land together.
